title: Brownie Cupcakes with Hazelnut Buttercream
description: These easy brownies are loaded with chopped hazelnuts, then they're topped with swirls of creamy chocolate-hazelnut frosting.

About Us The Allrecipes Allstars How to Add a Recipe GET THE MAGAZINE Recipes Ingredients Nuts and Seed Recipes Hazelnut Recipes Brownie Cupcakes with Hazelnut Buttercream 4.5 (15) 9 Reviews 6 Photos These easy brownies are loaded with chopped hazelnuts, then they're topped with swirls of creamy chocolate-hazelnut frosting. Submitted by Jif® Hazelnut Updated on August 22, 2022 Save Rate Print Share Close Add Photo 6 6 6 6 Prep Time: 15 mins Cook Time: 35 mins Total Time: 50 mins Servings: 12 Yield: 12 servings Jump to Nutrition Facts Cook Mode (Keep screen awake) Ingredients Brownies: 1 (19.5 ounce) box Pillsbury® Family Size Chocolate Fudge Brownie Mix ½ cup Crisco® Pure Vegetable Oil ¼ cup water 2 large eggs ½ cup chopped hazelnuts, plus additional chopped hazelnuts, for garnish Hazelnut Frosting: ¼ cup Crisco® All-Vegetable Shortening ¼ cup butter, softened ⅓ cup Jif® Chocolate Flavored Hazelnut Spread 1 ¼ cups powdered sugar ½ teaspoon vanilla extract ⅛ teaspoon salt 1 tablespoon milk, or more as needed Directions Heat oven to 350 degrees F. Line 12 muffin cups with paper baking cups. Prepare brownie mix according to package directions using oil, water and eggs. Stir in 1/2 cup of chopped hazelnuts. Fill baking cups 3/4 full. Bake 30 to 32 minutes or until centers are set. Cool 2 minutes. Remove from pan. Cool completely on wire racks. For Frosting: Beat shortening, butter and chocolate hazelnut spread in a large bowl, with an electric mixer on medium speed until smooth. Add powdered sugar, vanilla, salt and 1 tablespoon of milk. Beat slowly until combined. Beat on high, 3 to 5 minutes, adding an additional 1 tablespoon milk at a time until desired consistency is achieved. Frost cupcakes by placing frosting into corner of resealable plastic bag. Cut 1/2-inch off corner of bag. Starting at outside edge, work in circular motion to build up frosting moving towards center, creating a swirl effect. Sprinkle with reserved chopped hazelnuts. I Made It Print 26 home cooks made it! Nutrition Facts (per serving) 483 Calories 29g Fat 57g Carbs 4g Protein Show Full Nutrition Label Hide Full Nutrition Label Nutrition Facts Servings Per Recipe 12 Calories 483 % Daily Value * Total Fat 29g 37% Saturated Fat 6g 29% Cholesterol 41mg 14% Sodium 214mg 9% Total Carbohydrate 57g 21% Dietary Fiber 1g 4% Total Sugars 13g Protein 4g 8% Vitamin C 0mg 0% Calcium 14mg 1% Iron 0mg 2% Potassium 52mg 1% * Percent Daily Values are based on a 2,000 calorie diet. Your daily values may be higher or lower depending on your calorie needs. ** Nutrient information is not available for all ingredients. Amount is based on available nutrient data. (-) Information is not currently available for this nutrient. If you are following a medically restrictive diet, please consult your doctor or registered dietitian before preparing this recipe for personal consumption. Add Your Photo Photos of Brownie Cupcakes with Hazelnut Buttercream 01 of 06 Photo by  Allrecipes Member 02 of 06 Photo by  brittnic99 04/10/2017 03 of 06 Photo by  Joanna Hunter 09/28/2016 04 of 06 Photo by  brookeroni 04/06/2016 frosting is good but missing a kick. I'll try adding more nutella next time. the brownies overpower the frosting and it really can't be detected. may be better with a cupcake but with a brownie it is not flavorful enough. 05 of 06 Photo by  Lindsay Anderson 08/20/2014 1 You’ll Also Love Chocolate-Orange Cupcakes with Pistachio Buttercream 7 Ratings Chocolate Cupcakes with Cream Cheese-Oreo-Buttercream Frosting 8 Ratings Lemon Cupcake with Blackberry Buttercream 305 Ratings Cinco de Chili Chocolate Cupcakes with Chili Cream Cheese Frosting 120 Ratings Lemon-Blueberry Cupcakes with Blueberry-Lemon Buttercream Frosting 6 Ratings Swiss Hazelnut Taler 2 Ratings Christmas Santa Cupcakes 4 Ratings Gingerbread Cupcakes with Cream Cheese Frosting 149 Ratings Best Ever Nutella Frosting 4 Ratings Chocolate Cupcakes with Caramel Frosting 85 Ratings Peanut Butter Cup Chocolate Cupcakes with Toasted Peanut Butter Meringue Frosting 3 Ratings Raspberry White Chocolate Buttercream Cupcakes 46 Ratings Gingerbread Men Cookies with Nutella® hazelnut spread 2 Ratings Custard Buttercream 15 Ratings Strawberry-Chocolate Mini Cupcakes with White Chocolate Ganache 6 Ratings Hazelnut and Almond Cookies 8 Ratings Allrecipes Newsletters Follow Us Dinners Meals Ingredients Occasions Cuisines Kitchen Tips News Features About Us Editorial Process Privacy Policy Product Vetting Terms of Service Advertise Careers Contact Your Privacy Choices   Allrecipes is part of the Dotdash Meredith publishing family. name: Jif® Hazelnut
instructions: Heat oven to 350 degrees F. Line 12 muffin cups with paper baking cups. Prepare brownie mix according to package directions using oil, water and eggs. Stir in 1/2 cup of chopped hazelnuts. Fill baking cups 3/4 full.;Bake 30 to 32 minutes or until centers are set. Cool 2 minutes. Remove from pan. Cool completely on wire racks.;For Frosting: Beat shortening, butter and chocolate hazelnut spread in a large bowl, with an electric mixer on medium speed until smooth. Add powdered sugar, vanilla, salt and 1 tablespoon of milk. Beat slowly until combined. Beat on high, 3 to 5 minutes, adding an additional 1 tablespoon milk at a time until desired consistency is achieved.;Frost cupcakes by placing frosting into corner of resealable plastic bag. Cut 1/2-inch off corner of bag. Starting at outside edge, work in circular motion to build up frosting moving towards center, creating a swirl effect. Sprinkle with reserved chopped hazelnuts.
